**Meeting Time/Place**:

**Instructor**: Nissa Hui-shan Lin            **Email**: [hslin@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:hslin@ntnu.edu.tw)

**Office**: Cheng 705  

**Course Description:**  

This course introduces students to Optimality Theory and its application to phonology.  The course begins by introducing the background and basic concepts of the theory and then examines how the theory deals with issues related to syllable structure, stress, reduplication, truncation, and affixation. Students are required to read the class materials beforehand, to lead the discussion on the assigned readings, to participate actively in the class discussion, and to turn in a publishable research paper by the end of the semester.
